pr_title: l10n: Cloud name with a capital letter

timeline.message: l10n: Cloud name with a capital letter

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure if this is correct, as it not a name, but a description, like "green house" vs. "the White House".
It basically means that one can type an identifier of an user who is not on the same server, but on another/remote Netcloud server…
timeline.author: tobiasKaminsky
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -473,7 +473,7 @@
     <string name="share_with_title">Share with…</string>
     <string name="share_via_link_unset_password">Unset</string>
 
-    <string name="share_search">Name, federated cloud ID or email address…</string>
+    <string name="share_search">Name, Federated Cloud ID or email address…</string>

replies.bodyText:
Not sure if this is correct, as it not a name, but a description

If it's not a name then it should be regulated in other applications where "federated cloud" is taken as the name and capitalized.
replies.author: Valdnet

replies.bodyText: Thanks for taking care of the clarification 🎉
replies.author: AndyScherzinger

timeline.message: l10n: Add a space before the ellipsis
